The Method of Painting the Image of the Summit of All Buddhas, the Method of Painting the Image of the Summit of All Buddhas

The image of the summit of all buddhas is yellow all over the body with a red glow. In the center of the glow, five blue flames are emitted, long and short. Wearing a red single skirt, covering the shins, wearing a yellow kasaya with a blue lining, hanging down to the two knees, sitting on a hundred-treasure flower.

On the lotus flower, a single square treasure is placed, on the side of which are two red feet, shaped like the squatting feet of this land, paying homage, on the lotus flower above. A blue ground is spread above it.
On the two sides of the blue ground, each is placed with a red treasure platform, adorned with variegated ribbons, flower garlands, and jeweled brocade, intricately decorated.
On the top of the platform, each is placed with a lion, crouching on both sides, bearing a jeweled flower on the head to support the Buddha's seat.
The right hand of the image should have the index finger and thumb touching to form a hole, with the other three fingers extended and the palm facing forward.

The index finger of the left hand should be placed next to the hole of the right thumb, with the thumb almost touching as if about to pinch, the middle and ring fingers bent in the palm, and the little finger also extended in the right palm.
The back of the image should lean against a jeweled embroidered pillow, with a bodhisattva on each side, both with yellow bodies, headdresses, necklaces, and a bluish radiance.

The bodhisattvas attending on each side of the image and the vajra attendants have the same bluish radiance.ğŸ”½The bodhisattva attendant on the left side has the right arm bent, with the hand holding a white whisk, and the left arm extended downward, slightly bent on the thigh, with the hand holding a lotus flower.
A bluish flower sash is draped over the hips, with a jeweled belt tied at the waist, wearing a morning glow skirt, and a light gauze covering on the left hip.
He is also wearing a red chrysanthemum-patterned robe, with the hem hanging down outside over his right thigh, standing on a purple lotus flower.
The bodhisattva attendant on the right side has his left arm bent, with the palm facing forward holding a rosary with twenty-one beads, and his right arm extended on his thigh fanning.
He is wearing a blue-colored robe over his two thighs, with a jeweled sash tied at the waist, and a dawn-colored skirt, with a light gauze covering the skirt.
Under his left thigh, there is a green-colored robe hanging down over his right thigh, hanging down outside, standing on a purple-colored lotus flower.

Above the two attendant bodhisattvas, there are Sudha Heaven beings, their entire bodies white, with yellow cloaks draped over their shoulders and wearing true vermilion skirts, each on five-colored clouds, each scattering various flowers as offerings.

Furthermore, there are four bodhisattvas on each side, standing behind the bodhisattvas, majestic and awe-inspiring, their bodies upright and seated, assisting the Buddha's spiritual powers and guiding sentient beings.

The last bodhisattva has a whole body yellow color, a head adorned with a flower garland, a green halo, a red brocade sash, palms joined in respect, wears a morning glow skirt, and sits cross-legged on a blue lotus flower.
